Mapumental

Posted to Mottr.am by
Jack
on 08 November 2009 from Wirral. Tags: data mapping
Short URL: http://mottr.am/mm

Mapumental is a fascinating new project by MySociety.org and 4iP that builds on MySociety.org’s earlier work on data mapping.

Feed it a UK postcode, and it will generate an interactive choropleth map, which lets you see locations highlighted by public transport commute times, house prices and ‘scenicness’.

The service is in private beta at the moment. (My invitation arrived immediately after signing up, but the site is a wee bit slow, and prone to serving up error messages instead of maps–clearing cookies fixed everything for me, but your mileage may vary.)

Commenting via Twitter

If you have a Twitter account and would like to reply to this post, just tweet what you'd like to say, and make sure to put #mot_mm somewhere in your tweet.

The gobbledygook beginning with '#' is called a 'hashtag', and makes it easy for this site to search Twitter for your tweet, and display it on the correct page.

Alternatively, you can tweet about this post and include its short URL, http://mottr.am/mm, and your tweet will be displayed automatically, whether you use the hashtag or not.

If you don't have a Twitter account, feel free to send me an email instead, and I'll update the post with your comments: j@ck.mottr.am
